DataElement.preferredName: Fibrinogen Antigen Assay Performed Finding Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the results for the fibrinogen antigen assay.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A fibrillar protein present in blood plasma; it converts to fibrin during the process of blood clot formation._Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens._A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A fibrillar protein present in blood plasma; it converts to fibrin during the process of blood clot formation.:Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens.:A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.

Concepts.definition: A fibrillar protein present in blood plasma; it converts to fibrin during the process of blood clot formation.

Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens.
A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.
Executed and carried through to completion.
